channel.title: PAAW
channel.description: The Performance Adaptive Aeroelastic Wing program. Yes, it's a morphing wing!

item.title: Status
item.description:
Status Update

mAEWing1

  • FEM v4.2
    • may be free play of wing relative to center-body
    • using springs to model connection
      • UMN will conduct a GVT of the wing to update this model
    • updated FEM expected next week
  • Papers for AIAA Sci Tech session are due Dec. 1
  • STI will coordinate with NASA AFRC to attend X-56 GVT
  • IOROM complete for FEM v3.3, which is WS2 + Hati CB

item.title: Status
item.description:
Tactical Meeting

mAEWing1

  • FEM
    • Latest and best version is 4.2
    • Will go forward with this one:
      • CM Soft and Dave S will update models
  • Modeling
    • Aero coefficients, mode shapes, and state space models from Dave S will be sent to UMN

Status Update

mAEWing1

  • First wing bending frequency / speed gradient
    • Dave S and VT investigating sources with FEM, no conclusions yet, still in work

mAEWing2

  • VT working on mAEWing2
    • NASTRAN structural analysis
    • Updating mesh for flaps
    • Parameterizing flap shapes
    • Slope change for CML
  • UMN will send planform and winglet geometry to Dave S middle next week to begin model development
  • Aurora is expecting a quote from Stratasys regarding mold manufacturing soon

item.title: Status
item.description:
Status Update

mAEWing1

  • Hati with Wing Set 3
    • MOI and mass properties testing data sent to team
    • GVT data sent to STI
      • Will analyze and validate UMN’s results, then send to VT
    • Aft c.g. tests planned at 23 m/s and 26 m/s to gather open-loop dynamics data
    • Considering testing foreward c.g. for better low speed stability
      • Seems like a low damped phugoid is causing stability issues below 15 m/s
  • CM Soft modeling Hati + FEM 3.3
  • Dave S. analyzing mis-match between models and flight test results for Skoll + WS1
    • Two reasons for different slope of flutter frequency with speed
      • Mode shape
      • Lift distribution

item.title: Status
item.description:
Status Update

mAEWing1

  • Hati with Wing Set 2
    • Good GVT complete, except for 1 mode around 5.2 Hz which is difficult to identify
      • Conducting additional tests close to that mode
    • Mass properties testing complete
    • Anticipated 1-2 weeks for FEM update once GVT testing is complete
    • Models are a quick turn around after the FEM update
  • Sköll with Wing Set 1
    • Cleaning up models and validating against each other and against the flight data

item.title: Status
item.description:
Status Update

mAEWing1

  • Sköll with Wing Set 1
    • Flight 12 captured open-loop chirp data at 27 m/s
    • Flight 13 found open-loop flutter at 30 m/s
      • Wing Set 1 is likely a loss, the Sköll center-body can be repaired
    • Updated FEM is matching mode shapes from GVT, asymmetry is causing some slight differences in mode shape and frequencies
  • Hati with Wing Set 2 is in integration
    • Anticipated to be complete 8/28
    • GVT scheduled 8/29 and 8/30
      • Should change the excitation force point for better identification of torsion modes

mAEWing2

  • VT working on defining material properties for the sandwich panel
  • Nearly complete with analysis module part of the shape optimization

item.title: Status
item.description:
Status Update

mAEWing1

  • Next flights on Sköll:
    • Split into two flights:
      • Flight 1: Chirps at 27 m/s
      • Flight 2: Chirps at 23 m/s (repeat of previous test) and open loop speed ramp to find flutter
  • Re-ran GVT on wing set 1, 3-35 Hz and 3-13 Hz
    • Will be sending data out for a model update
  • STI concentrating on GVT update
  • STI starting to look at Flight 09 data, working with UMN for parameter estimation then a model update
  • Dave S. conducting model comparisons with STI, wrapping up a working paper on a flutter suppression controller with robustness against all of the available models
  • VT updated FEM to match mode frequencies for Wing Set 1 based on older UMN GVT

mAEWing2

  • VT using scaled X-56 as an initial design to optimize from
    • 1st step is to design a wing box for flutter at 60 knots
  • Aurora sent 3D printed mold design out for quotes

item.title: Status
item.description:
Status Update

  • Will meet as a team afternoon before NASA annual review
  • Plan on attending 8-3 on the day of the annual review, 8-5 if you would like to attend the closed sessions

mAEWing1

  • Flights 06 - 09 completed on Sköll
    • Flight 06 had a motor issue and landed shortly after takeoff with no test data collected
    • Flight 07 - 09
      • 23 m/s chirps open-loop on L3/R3 followed by L4/R4. 15 second chirps with a frequency range between about 1-10 Hz and a magnitude of 5 degrees on L3/R3 and 3 degrees on L4/R4.
      • 23 m/s 3-2-1-1 inputs open-loop on L3/R3 followed by L4/R4.
      • Open-loop flight is accomplished by the pilot directly controlling L2/R2 surface deflection for roll control and L3/R3 surface deflection for pitch control.
      • 23 m/s 3-2-1-1 inputs closed-loop on L3/R3 followed by L4/R4. The closed-loop control law is our standard rigid body control law for this vehicle; phi tracking is via L2/R2, theta tracking via L3/R3 and L4/R4 are used as an elevon.
      • 23 m/s theta doublet followed by phi doublet closed-loop on a modified rigid body control law that does not use the L4/R4 surfaces.
      • Flight data quality looks excellent for estimation of aero and flexible body dynamics.
      • Landings were very smooth and repeatable.
      • Able to track shape change with Wing Set 2.
  • Dave S. and STI are checking control law robustness against all of the available aircraft models.

mAEWing2

  • UMN and VT will have side discussions regarding mAEWing2 design
    • Material selection
    • Rib and spar layout
    • Control surface design

item.title: Status
item.description:
Status Update

  • NASA annual review meeting in late October

mAEWing1

  • Dave S. will send new parameter identification routine based on updated FEM
  • Upcoming parameter estimation flight tests
    • Chirps, 3-2-1-1 open loop at 23 m/s
  • STI
    • Conducted a system identification study and emailed to the sub-group
      • Used de-correlated inputs, transfer functions, and subspace identification
    • Still compares well with Dave’s model
    • Looked at SMI data for Wing Set 1, identified modes and sent a report
      • Saw a torsion mode, but it might the second based on the frequency
  • VT updated FEM to match mode shapes and frequencies with Wing Set 1 GVT

mAEWing2

  • VT began designing LE surfaces and TE conformal mold line flaps
  • Aurora and UMN have converged on a mold design for the mAEWing2 wings

item.title: Status
item.description:
Status Update

mAEWing1

  • Dave S. model a good fit to the flight data at 20 m/s and 30 m/s with some slight parameter tweaks.
  • Planning to fly Hinf
    • Use L4/R4 to suppress 1st wing bending
    • Sensing q, center-body accels, and wingtip accels
    • Will send a short description
  • Dave S. emailed model updates to the group
    • Lateral directional, aft c.g. for Wing Set 2
    • Lateral directional dynamics not as sensitive to c.g. position as longitudinal dynamics
  • STI
    • Working on system identification using SIDPAC, output-error and frequency domain analysis
    • Comparing model with Dave S. with good comparisons
    • MATLAB GUI ready for real-time frequency and damping during flight
  • VT completed FEM update from the Wing Set 2 static testing
    • FEMS now available for Wing Set 1 and Wing Set 2

mAEWing2

  • VT needs preliminary material properties
    • Initial design loads of +3.8/-1 and a 1.5 factor of safety
    • Initial flap deflection range of +/-35 degrees
  • Aurora will talking with mold suppliers
    • Working mAEWing2 and xAEWing3
    • Will use mAEWing2 mold to R&D approaches for xAEWing3 mold design
    • Leaning towards 3D printed molds

item.title: Status
item.description:
Status Update

mAEWing1

  • Flight computer speed up to 100 Hz.
  • Wing Set 2 wing accelerometers installed on 3D printed brackets to increase spacing off spar.
  • Wing Set 2 wiring complete
  • Wing Set 2 static testing complete, holding for GVT following completion of WS 1 Flight Testing or completion of the Hati center body.
  • VT updated FEM, good matching with measured mass properties.
  • STI testing model matching with Dave S. model, good matching so far.
  • Will have sidebar discussions between Dave S., STI, and UMN regarding mAEWing1 parameter estimation from flight data.

mAEWing2

  • Aurora has been developing tooling options to send to UMN.
